data.title: Homicides by Year
data.text:
Below are some of the Richmond Police Department's unsolved homicide cases.

If you have any information that will help us clear a case, please call us at (804) 646-6741 or CrimeStoppers at (804) 780-1000.

WARNING: Some of the photos or descriptions may be disturbing.

Mikell S. Brown - Date of Homicide: October 6, 2005

On October 6, 2005 at approximately 4:50 a.m., police responded to the 3200 block of 1st Avenue for the report of a person found unconscious in the alley.

Upon arrival, they found, Mikell Sylvester Brown, who had been assaulted. He was pronounced dead at the scene by medical personnel.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Randolph Scott - Date of Homicide: January 17, 2005

The Richmond Police Department needs your assistance in solving the murder of Randolph Scott Jr.

On January 17, 2005 at approximately 3:40 a.m., Richmond Police responded to the area of Lauradale Lane and Pompey Springs Road in South Richmond. Upon their arrival they found the victim, Randolph Scott Jr., had been shot and killed while sitting in his car.

The family of Mr. Scott has established a monetary award of $5,000 to be awarded to any person, or equally divided among persons, who provide information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individual(s) responsible for the death of Randolph Scott Jr.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Frederico Hawkins - Date of Homicide: April 2, 2004

Around 10:40 a.m. on the morning of April 2, 2004 police responded to the 3400 block of Carolina Ave on a report of a person shot. After units arrived on the scene they found the victim, Frederico Tarish Hawkins, dead in the middle of the street.

According to witnesses a blue Oldsmobile was seen leaving the area quickly after the shots were fired. Only one black male occupant was in the Oldsmobile.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Anthony Jones Jr. – AKA Lil Boo - Date of Homicide: January 21, 2004

On January 21, 2004 at approximately 1:00 am., police responded to the 1800 block of North 28th Street for a report of a person down in the street. When police arrived on scene they found Anthony Jones Jr., 25 years of age deceased lying in the street from apparent gunshot wounds.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide. If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers – (804) 780-1000

Victoria Parent - Date of Homicide: December 15, 2002

Victoria Parent was arriving at her friend's home to visit around 10:15 p.m. They had worked it out so that she and her friend arrived about the same time. When the victim got out of her vehicle, which was parked on Floyd Ave and walked over to the house on Colonial Ave she was attacked by an unknown B/M. They exchanged some words and the suspect took her purse. When he took the purse from her she struggled. Then there were shots fired. The victim was hit and she died at MCV a short time later. The police are looking for any information that will help us solve this crime.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Jermaine Johnson - Date of Homicide: November 29, 2002

Shortly after midnight on November 29, 2002 Jermaine Johnson was standing with a group of males in the 3400 block of Maury Street. A small car pulled into a lot not far from where the group was standing and the occupants of that car fired at them. Jermaine Johnson was shot in his right shoulder and his left lower leg. Two other men in that group were also shot and wounded. The assailants then fled the area in their vehicle. Physical evidence from the scene indicates that more than one suspect fired at the victims.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Lee Hawkins Jr., Vernard Johnson & Felix Neversome - Date of Homicide: November 2, 2002

Shortly after midnight on November 2, 2002 police were called to 2104 Dinwiddie Avenue to investigate a shooting.

Upon arrival police found two people shot to death.

A third victim was wounded and taken MCV where he later died.

Investigators determined that the first two victims were shot multiple times and were killed where they were found. Two black males suspects, one of whom was armed, then ran east on Dinwiddie Avenue and shot the third victim as he was running away from the gunfire.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Yeon Heui Cho- Date of Homicide: April 15, 2002

AKA: Nancy Cho

On April 15, 2002, at 7:23 p.m., police units responded to 3111 Hull Street on the report of a robbery. Upon arrival they found Nancy Cho suffering from a gunshot wound to the chest. She was transported to the Virginia Commonwealth University Hospital and was later pronounced dead. Witnesses at the scene stated that an unknown armed and masked black male entered the store. The black male grabbed the victim and demanded cash from the safe. Unable to open the safe, the suspect then took money from the store. As the suspect was leaving the store, the victim yelled something causing the suspect to shoot her.

The suspect is a black male, 5'6" to 5'8" tall, 150 to 160 pounds, 25 to 30 years of age, wearing a tan shirt and dark jeans.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Anthony Davis & Calvin Mosley - Date of Homicide: November 18, 2001

On the morning of November 18, 2001 around 4:30 a.m. Second Precinct Units responded to 15th & Gordon Ave, on a green SUV parked outside of the Waste Management on Gordon Ave. Upon Officers arrival on the scene they discovered the bodies of Calvin Moseley and Anthony T. Davis both suffering from gunshot wounds. Both victims were pronounced dead at the scene.

According to people in the area two black males were seen running from the scene. One of the suspect's was wearing a brown hunting type jumpsuit. The other suspect was wearing all dark clothing.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804)646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804)780-1000

George Norrell - Date of Homicide: September 1, 2001

On Sept. 1, 2001, about 12:25 a.m., George Norrell was shot and killed in the 1000 block of Dove Street.

He was standing with his wife and another person when a vehicle approached the area and began firing at them.

Norrell pushed his wife out of the way and was struck by a bullet. His wife and the other person were also struck.

Norrell died as a result of the wound. His wife and the other person survived their wounds.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Erica Michelle Brown - Date of Homicide: July 30, 2001

Around 5:00 a.m. on the morning of July 30, 2001 Second Precinct Units responded to the 5800 block of Orcutt Lane on a person shot inside of the residence. Ms. Erica Michelle Brown was found shot to death inside her apartment.

According to people in the area the suspect, an unknown black male was seen running from the area of her apartment. The unknown subject was around 6'feet, 160lbs, wearing dark jeans and a dark shirt.

If you witnessed this shooting or if the suspect in this case has spoken to you about it, please contact the investigator assigned to the case. You may have the information needed to solve this case.

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Latrice Hulin & Herman Woolfolk III - Date of Homicide: April 22, 2001

Herman Lee Woolfolk III, a 19-year-old male, was found stabbed to death inside his silver Taurus.

He was with Latrice Hulin, a 17-year-old female.

They left Herman's house enroute to Latrice's house and were found dead inside the trunk the next day in Gilpin Court.

Latrice Hulin, a 17-year-old female, went with Herman Woolfolk to his house and then left to go home but never arrived.

She was found dead by her mother the next day in Gilpin Court.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Donald Jerome Harris - Date of Homicide: December 11, 2000

The body of Donald Jerome Harris was found inside his vehicle at Gilley’s Creek and Jennie Scher Rd. The autopsy revealed he had been shot to death.

The Richmond Police are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Janet McCabe - Date of Homicide: September 5, 2000

On 09-05-2000 Janet McCabe did not show up for work at the Beyond the Fringe hair salon. An unknown coworker went by her home at 4800 Patterson Avenue to check on her but no one answered the door. At approximately 1207 hours the Richmond Police Department was notified and officers responded to the residence. Responding officers found the residence insecure and when they got no response at the door they made entry into the residence and found the victim inside deceased, suffering from undetermined injuries. An autopsy revealed that the victim died as a result of gunshot wounds.

The Richmond Police are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

John Jordan - Date of Homicide: June 26, 2000

Around 2:00 a.m. on the morning of June 26, 2000 John Jordan was taking a friend home. He drove his dark green Dodge Neon through Gilpin Court and stopped at the stop sign at St. John and Hill Streets. There he was confronted by several suspects in a dark colored car who fired several shots into John's car. John was hit and was taken to MCV Hospital by a passenger in his car. John Jordan died of his wounds the following day.

The suspects in this case may have been involved in an altercation or random gunfire at the Boss Club near Harrison & Grace Streets shortly before the murder. They may also have been involved in a shooting or random gunfire near The Palace nightclub sometime after this murder.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Kenneth & Anajanette Murphy - Date of Homicide: April 14, 2000

On April 14, 2000, Kenneth and Anjanette Murphy were shot and killed in their home on Montecrest Avenue after unknown subjects kicked in their door.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this brutal crime.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Jamaal Daron Tisdale - Date of Homicide: April 6, 2000

On April 6, 2000 at approximately 12:56 a.m., police responded to an alley in the 700 block of Rex Avenue for a person shot. When police arrived they located, Jamaal Tisdale, with apparent gunshot wounds. Detectives canvassed the neighborhood and spoke with residents who heard gunshots between 10:00 p.m. and 11 p.m. on April 5, 2000.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Henry Northington - Date of Homicide: March 1, 1999

Police were called about 10:21 a.m. on March 1, 1999, to the area of the 1900 block of Texas Avenue. A 20-year-old white female and a 22-year-old white male found a human head sitting on the walkway on the south end of the bridge, near the parking lot. The head belonged to a white male, and it had been severed at the neck.

They immediately they called the police. After police arrived they conducted a search of the area for the rest of the body. About 1:10 p.m. the victim's body was located east of the Texas Avenue location. The body was in the water about 3/4 of a mile away from where the head was found.

Both scenes were processed and police recovered a large amount of evidence.

However, police still need help in solving this crime.

We know someone out there knows what happened to Northington and why it happened.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Daniel L. Roop - Date of Homicide: February 17, 1999

On February 17, 1999 at approximately 12:50 a.m., police responded to the 2400 block of Drake Street after residents reported hearing a gunshot. When police arrived, they found Daniel Roop, unconscious and not breathing, as a result of a gunshot wound. Drake Street is located in Richmond’s South Side and the homicide location is near Bellmeade and Jefferson Davis Highway.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Thomas G. Harvey - Date of Homicide: October 10, 1998

Around 3:50 a.m. on the morning of October 10, 1998 police responded to the 3100 block of Alvis Avenue on a report of shots fired and a person down. Mr. Thomas G. Harvey (Tommy) was found shot to death in the street.

According to witnesses the suspect was seen leaving the area of the homicide in the victim's white pick-up. The vehicle was recovered days later in an apartment Complex in Henrico County.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Karen Denise Green - Date of Homicide: August 16, 1998

On August 16, 1998 at approximately 6:00 a.m., police responded to the 5000 block of Red Oak Lane for a person shot. Upon police arrival, they located, Karen Denise Green, on the stoop of the residence with an apparent gunshot wound. She was pronounced dead at the scene by medical personnel.

Police Detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Corey L. Taylor - Date of Homicide: January 6, 1998

On January 6, 1998 at approximately 1:00 a.m., police responded to the 2000 block of N. 29th Street after residents reported hearing gunshots. When police arrived, they found Corey Lamont Taylor, 19 years of age, in his vehicle unconscious and not breathing.

Police detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Cynthia & Heather Johnson - Date of Homicide: August 29, 1996

On Aug. 29, 1996, Heather Johnson, 7, and Cynthia Johnson, 34, were murdered in their own home on Junaluska Drive in South Richmond. The home was set on fire to cover the crime. The victim was last talked to on Aug. 29, 1996, just a short time prior to the fire. This crime was one of Richmond's most horrific murders.

The victim knew the killer(s) and police need your help in solving this case.

The police have compiled a great deal of information on this case and need you to help us bring it to a successful close. We believe someone knows who the suspects are and can help solve this case.

If you have any information about this case no matter how small or unimportant you believe it is, we want you to call us and pass that information on to us. You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we need.

We also know that pizza was delivered to this address the night of the murders. We need to know who delivered the pizza to the address.

If you are the pizza delivery driver that delivered pizza to 6535 Junaluska Drive on the night of Aug. 29, 1996, please call and talk to investigators.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Richard A. Kruk- Date of Homicide: April 6, 1996

Richard Allan Kruk was staying in Richmond while working for Teletech, Inc. On 04/06/1996 at approximately 10:15 p.m., the Richmond Fire Department was called to the Econo Lodge, located at 6523 Midlothian Turnpike, for a fire in room #133. After the fire was extinguished they discovered the body of a deceased white male laying in the bed and called RPD. Patrol officers, arson investigators and forensics detectives responded to the scene. The case was later ruled a homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Reginald L. Battle - Date of Homicide: September 16, 1995

On September 26, 1995 at approximately 8:20 p.m., police responded to the 5200 block of Warwick Road for a person shot. Upon police arrival, they located Reginald L. Battle with apparent gunshot wounds. He was transported to VCU Medical Center where he was later pronounced dead by medical personnel.

Police Detectives and family members are asking for your help in solving this homicide.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Barbara J. Schwartz - Date of Homicide: March 7, 1992

On March 7, 1992 at approximately 12:12 a.m., police responded to the residence located at 1202 Porter Street in South Richmond. Upon their arrival they found the victim, Barbara J. Schwartz, dead in her room.

In the late hours of March 6th, Ms. Schwartz had been conversing with two acquaintances when a black male approached. Ms. Schwartz excused herself from the conversation and stepped inside with the black male alone. After a short amount of time, the two acquaintances knocked back on the door and the unknown black male fled from the scene. Ms. Schwartz was discovered at that time and police were called to investigate her death.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Ruth L. Foreman & Juan R. Rivera - Date of Homicide: October 11, 1991

On October 11, 1991 at approximately 10:20 a.m., police responded to 48 W. Pilkington Street Apt. 33 in South Richmond. Upon their arrival they found the bodies of Juan R. Rivera and Ruth L. Foreman. Ms. Foreman was last seen alive by relatives on October 6th. Both victims had been living in the apartment.

Neighbors reported hearing nothing out of the ordinary in the days prior to the discovery of the victims.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:

Homicide Detectives - (804) 646-6741

Crime Stoppers - (804) 780-1000

Barbara Ellen Powers - Date of Homicide: May 12, 1988

On May 12, 1988, between 1:30 a.m. – 1:45 a.m., Barbara Powers, a VCU student and also a band manager for a local Richmond Punk Rock group named the Undertakers was walking home after meeting with the group. While walking in the area of 112 N. Plum Street, the victim was confronted by a black male described as slender to medium build, 6’0” to 6’2” with short hair and a moustache. During what appears to have been an attempted robbery, Powers was stabbed to death. Witnesses in the area heard an argument and Powers screaming during the assault. The suspect left the area on a bicycle southbound on Plum Street and turned into the south alley in the 1500 block of Grove Avenue.

The suspect was also involved in an attempted robbery and stabbing 20 minutes prior to Powers being killed. The first assault occurred in the 2000 Block of Park Avenue. The victim was severely injured and survived the attack.

If you have any information about this homicide or about someone who knows information about this homicide please contact:
